title: Two Sum
description:
Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return the indices of the two numbers that add up to target.

You may assume each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

Return the answer in any order.
explanation: Use a hashmap to store numbers and their indices while iterating. For each number, check if target - nums[i] already exists in hashmap.

title: Palindrome Number
description:
Given an integer x, return true if x is a palindrome, otherwise false.

A palindrome is a number that reads the same backward as forward.
explanation: Convert to string, or reverse the number mathematically without converting.

title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
description:
Given a sorted array nums, remove duplicates in-place so that each unique element appears only once.
Return the number of unique elements.

Modify the input array in-place and return the new length.
explanation: Use two pointers. One pointer iterates; the other writes unique elements.

title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
description: You are given the heads of two sorted linked lists. Merge the two lists into one sorted list and return the head.
explanation: Use two pointers to merge nodes one by one.

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
description:
Given an array prices where prices[i] is the price of a stock on day i, return the maximum profit.

You must buy before you sell.
explanation: Track minimum price; compute max profit with single pass.
